message: looks like http://www.ellingtoncms.com (it's not open-source)
hey all!! who can recommend me a Open source CMS for online newspaper based in django??? thanks
this looks promising http://armstrongcms.org/
What are your specific requirements
checking out armstrong
djangopackages.com is good for researching these kinds of things.
PBS is using django-cms though I don't know the newspaper biz.

The short answer is that there isn't a CMS that is a) Django-powered b) completely open source and c) worth using. Armstrong is promising, but tell your editor your story is promising. I've never used Ellington, mostly because it's not free. That's not a knock; I just don't have a budget and places I've worked were already invested in some CMS when I arrived.
The Washington Times crew has released nearly all their apps as open source, and Calloway, their prototyping framework. I'd be happy to help you assemble them if you'd like.
@eyeseast You mean I should development one CMS for my organization??
thanks,  it's a good idea @coordt
@diefenbach It looks like a newspaper website like washingtonpost, it include news, videos, audio news, and classifieds.. and Ads system... i think Django-CMS isn't enough for this..
thanks @Vasil I am waiting for it release..

Armstrong is an open-source CMS that is freely available to any organization. It is the result of a collaboration between The Texas Tribune and Bay Citizen, and a grant from the John S. and James L. Knight Foundation. The first release is scheduled for June, 2011.
@eyeseast huh?
@rehmetjan I wonder how many people read your post in a PBS voice.
I'll hopefully be getting an early look at Armstrong this week or next. Hoping it's worth using for a project I'm working on now. I'll of course post early feedback here.
@ericmoritz I don't understand what you mean
@coordt Wow Calloway seems really interesting. Already using your stories and categories apps but I definitely have to check out Calloway as well.

@rehmetjan Your post reminding me of the "sponsored by" spots at the end of PBS shows such as Nova or Frontline.. i.e., "Nova is brought to you by grants from the John D and Catherine T Macarthur Foundation" I tried to find a video clip, but came up short.
